body:
My Girl

Pairings: Clint Barton x female oc

Word Count: 2,049 (cut down from a lottt)

Summary: The avengers are looking for where Thanos might be so they can take him down early. Clint convinces them that a woman named Blair might be a lead. Without telling them who she really is, Clint convinces Tony to let him watch her. Making old memories pop up for Clint.

Warnings: SMUT (unprotected), Language

A/N: So my prompt was “who is she?” for the Marvel Writing Challenge started by @cleolemonfanfiction Hopefully this isn’t too bad. Also this takes place as if Clint was involved in Infinity War. This is my first smut too guys.

•

{Clint’s POV}

As I’m standing outside the white-picket-fenced house, watching the woman with blonde hair my earpiece turns on.

“Do you really think this is wise, Clint?” I can hear Tony say, “We don’t even know this girl. There’s just no evidence of her having any connection to Thanos. Maybe you should head back. We shouldn’t have kept this from the team anyway.”

“No, Tony,” I reply, “I just.. I need this right now. Okay? Maybe she does have a connection you just need to let me see.”

“Is this personal, Barton? We’re trying to find Thanos not reconnect your past hookups.”

“Shut up, Tony.”

“No, Barton, you will get your ass back here.”

“No I won’t.” I say back and start fiddling with my earpiece.

“Tell me one reason why I shouldn’t come and get you. Who is she, Barton?”

“Don’t worry about it.”

4 Years Ago

“I’ll be there when I get there, don’t worry about it, okay?” I say angrily to my phone and quickly hang up before I hear a response.

The girl in front of me is ordering a cofee that sounds like she’s making her own from the others on the menu. I look at my watch and roll my eyes.

“And the name?” The guy at the counter asks.

“Blair.” She responds. Checking for her wallet. I can tell she’s getting nervous. She probably feels bad for holding up an entire line.

“I-I’m sorry I swear I have my wallet in here, ya know, some-somewhere.” She’s stuttering now, I take out a twenty and put it on the counter.

“Don’t worry, I got it.” She smiles and takes a few steps to the side while she gets her coffee. I order an Americano and walk away.

“Hey! Um-you!” I hear someone shout. I turn around and the girl from the coffee shop is running towards me. When she catches up I can finally see her appearance, she has big, green eyes, with long, blonde hair. She hands me a twenty.

“Like I said, I had my wallet. But thank you for getting that.” She says, shyly.

“It’s no problem, keep it.” She puts it in my coat pocket anyway.

“Nope, this way, I don’t feel like that was charity, or something.”

I laugh a little, “Alright then,” and start to walk away again. She starts walking with me and I give her a weird look.

“I just, ya know, really wanted to pay you back because I’m not like someone who accepts stuff like that,” She says this all very awkwardly, and I don’t know how to react.

“Look, don’t worry, okay? It’s just a simple thing.”

“Oh, yeah, okay. Um, Blair-I mean my name is Blair and I’m not usually this awkward you’re just… so um, anyway,” I read her lips more than I hear the awkward sentence structure. She’s stuttering over her words and blushing.

“It’s okay,” I laugh at her awkwardness. “I’m Clint. It’s nice to meet you, Blair.”

Present

The sound of a car driving up sends me back in to present and promptly ends my thoughts. Blair is gripping her sink with her head down. There’s a glass next to her and she keeps looking at it like she’s imagining it filling up.

“Barton, now,” Tony had came up behind me and was now trying to get me to leave, “We need to go. This was never supposed to be personal.”

“Yeah, whatever,” I get up and walk with him to the car.

“We’ll keep this between us, Clint,” Tony starts his lecture. “But you’re not to see that girl again. Get your head in the damn game. Thanos is the problem. Not some random girl you hooked up with and are feeling the need to stalk.”

I tune him out hearing his rant in the background as I look up at the sky and slowly drift off to sleep.

3 years ago

“Clint hurry! It’s pouring!” Blair says to me and laughs.

“That’s the point it’s fun!” I say back, and pull her in to our apartment. She’s laughing at me and stands up on her toes and kisses me. I wrap my arms around her waist and kiss back. She jumps up and wraps her legs around my waist.

“Like you said, it’s fun.” She winks at me and kisses me again. She’s running her fingers through my hair while her other hand runs down my back.

I quickly get us in to the bedroom and softly drop her down on to the bed, climbing on top of her with my arms on either sides of her. She starts pulling my shirt off. I take the hint and sit up to pull it off doing the same to her.

I kiss from her lips, down her jawline,to the middle of her chest, she moans and starts grinding her hips against me. I sit her up and she bites my earlobe as I unclip her bra and slip my hand down her pants.

She gasps at the sudden contact and moans as I start rubbing circles on her clit. And my jeans become tighter. She kisses me desperately.

“Clint, baby, please,” she’s practically begging for it. The tone in her voice is seductive yet innocent.

“Tell me what you want, princess,” I say as I kiss her jawline and slowly insert a finger inside her pumping in and out slowly. She moans loudly and I feel her start to get more wet than she already was. I push a second finger inside her and push them in faster and harder.

“You, Clint, I want you,” she’s scratching up my arms and back and I kiss her roughly. I pull her pants off quickly, with her panties along with them. I do the same to my pants and boxers and dick springs free. I start lining myself up to her and look down.

“Are you sure, Blair?”

“Yes, now please. I need you inside me, Clint.” And with that I push myself inside of her. She winces and gasps. I wait for her to give me some kind of signal to move, to show she’s adjusted to me. She lets out her breath and opens her eyes I start moving slowly. She’s moaning and her chest is bouncing right along with my thrusts.

“Faster, please,” she wraps her legs around my waist and pulls me closer. I thrust into her faster and she scratches my back. And starts screaming my name. She lifts her hips off the bed and she grips the sheets.

“Clint I’m going to..” She starts clenching around me and her legs start shaking.

“Cum for me baby,” I say. She screams my name one last time before she grips me tightly. I keep thrusting into her a few more times and pull out just in time to finish on my hand. I clean up the mess and she grabs one of my shirts.

“Come here,” I say, and she falls asleep in my arms.

Present

I wake up to muffled talking outside my room. I grumble and roll over, checking the time. It’s almost 10 a.m. I get up and hurriedly put on a T-shirt and jeans, opening the door to see Tony outside my room.

“Move,” I say and bump him with my shoulder to walk by.

“We should talk about what happened last night, Barton.” I ignore him. He walks past me in to the main room of headquarters where they’re talking about Thanos.

“He already has three of the stones, we need to stop him before he gets a fourth.” Steve is saying. This is all they’ve been talking about, which I know is important, but it’s annoying. I grab keys and walk out.

“Where are you going?!” Steve shouts

“Out!” I yell back

2 years ago

I wake up when I feel weight on top of my body and the sun shining obnoxiously through the blinds.

“Wake up, Sleepyhead,” I slowly open my eyes, grimacing at the annoying light. I see beautiful, green eyes, looking at me through long blonde hair, straddling me and her sweater dropping off her shoulder.

“No, it’s too early. Let me sleep, Blair.” I smile and try to roll over but she’s enjoying this too much to let me, and she pins my arms to the bed.

“Uh-uh Clint, I think you owe me a lot of attention.” I look up at her and groan.

“Now do I?” I overpower her and flip us over and kiss her and she laughs.

“Yes, you do,” kissing her back and laying back down on the bed.

“We should do something today,” she says.

“Like what?” I rub my face, slowly waking up.

“I don’t know, something. Go see a movie and go out to dinner, maybe. Please.”

“Alright, we will. I’ll take you shopping too.”

“Yay! Thank you!” She says and kisses me again and cuddles up against my side. The things I do for this girl.

Present

I pull up to Blair’s house. She’s in her kitchen again. Talking to someone on the phone. Before I know it I’m walking up to the door and standing on the doorstep trying to get the courage to knock.

1 year ago

I pull up to our apartment at about 12 a.m. I told Blair not to wait up for me. But the lights are on, indicating she did anyway. I walk up and unlock our door. She’s eating a big bowl of popcorn, and watching a movie.

“What are you still doing up?” I ask her

“Why are you out so late?” She remarks back.

Present

I knock on the door and I hear footsteps and she opens it. She obviously looks just the same. Maybe happier but it’s still my Blair.

“Clint? What-What are you doing here?” She asks, “I haven’t seen you in a while,” she leans against the doorway.

“Yeah it’s been a year,” I say and look down.

1 year ago

“I’m getting tired of this Clint. This is what you’ve been doing for the past fucking month. What’s going on with you?” She asks, irritated.

“I’m just working late, Blair. You know that.”

“Yeah okay, what about leaving in the middle of the night, for work? Or not coming home until the next day?” She asks again. I can’t tell her what’s been going on, about the team. It’s to keep her safe.

“It’s just work. It’s nothing.” I say back and she’s getting even more mad now.

“Yeah, okay. You’re such a liar. I can tell you’re lying to me. Either tell me the truth or get out.” She lays down an ultimatum and my heart drops. I get frustrated, and stay quiet. But I shouldn’t be. I am lying.

“Get out, now.”

Present

“Really? It’s been that long? Wow.” She says.

“I just ya know, wanted to check on you.I was just driving by..” I rub the back of my neck.

“I’m good,” she says, “What about you?”

“I’m okay,” there’s an awkward silence for a second. “Would you like to go out sometime?”

“Clint, I don’t know…”

“I just want to be able to explain everything?” I say.

“After a year, you finally want to explain?” She says sarcastically. “Fine,” she sighs. “Tonight 7:30. Don’t be late.”

I finally got my girl back.

“Like what?” I rub my face, slowly waking up.

“I don’t know, something. Go see a movie and go out to dinner, maybe. Please.”

“Alright, we will. I’ll take you shopping too.”

“Yay! Thank you!” She says and kisses me again and cuddles up against my side. The things I do for this girl.

Present

I pull up to Blair’s house. She’s in her kitchen again. Talking to someone on the phone. Before I know it I’m walking up to the door and standing on the doorstep trying to get the courage to knock.

1 year ago

I pull up to our apartment at about 12 a.m. I told Blair not to wait up for me. But the lights are on, indicating she did anyway. I walk up and unlock our door. She’s eating a big bowl of popcorn, and watching a movie.

“What are you still doing up?” I ask her

“Why are you out so late?” She remarks back.

Present

I knock on the door and I hear footsteps and she opens it. She obviously looks just the same. Maybe happier but it’s still my Blair.

“Clint? What-What are you doing here?” She asks, “I haven’t seen you in a while,” she leans against the doorway.

“Yeah it’s been a year,” I say and look down.

1 year ago

“I’m getting tired of this Clint. This is what you’ve been doing for the past fucking month. What’s going on with you?” She asks, irritated.

“I’m just working late, Blair. You know that.”

“Yeah okay, what about leaving in the middle of the night, for work? Or not coming home until the next day?” She asks again. I can’t tell her what’s been going on, about the team. It’s to keep her safe.

“It’s just work. It’s nothing.” I say back and she’s getting even more mad now.

“Yeah, okay. You’re such a liar. I can tell you’re lying to me. Either tell me the truth or get out.” She lays down an ultimatum and my heart drops. I get frustrated, and stay quiet. But I shouldn’t be. I am lying.

“Get out, now.”

Present

“Really? It’s been that long? Wow.” She says.

“I just ya know, wanted to check on you.I was just driving by..” I rub the back of my neck.

“I’m good,” she says, “What about you?”

“I’m okay,” there’s an awkward silence for a second. “Would you like to go out sometime?”

“Clint, I don’t know…”

“I just want to be able to explain everything?” I say.

“After a year, you finally want to explain?” She says sarcastically. “Fine,” she sighs. “Tonight 7:30. Don’t be late.”

Warnings: SMUT (unprotected), Language

body:
Alright pumpkins, its headcanon/plot bunny time.

It’s time for a break from the fluffy and sweetness before we all get cavities, here’s a wonderfully angsty AU!

(More of the 85th Floor series later on, I’m not done yet.)

So I had an idea hit me, where there are a lot of “Tony/(Character) were married before Civil War.”

But I’m missing my Clint Barton/Tony Stark angst piece.

SO! I have a plot bunny. Buckle up kiddies because we’re going in. 

Tony Stark, is a valuable asset to the future of SHIELD, and as such, is protected. So when Tony goes off to MIT at the ripe age of 15, (go with it for this AU) he himself needs a handler. So, they assign young 18 year old Clint Barton to the case, who’s ready to prove himself, he’s got this.

Five kidnapping attempts, two birthdays, and a graduation later, Tony Stark is 17, and still the fluffy little nerd that Clint’s grown attached to. Queue freak out. Because he’s not supposed to get attached, hes only supposed to be there if something goes wrong. Hes certainly not supposed to know how Tony sleeps with the light on after a nightmare, or that he loves to snuggle on the couch and watch Disney movies.

So he tries distancing himself, which, doesn’t do any of them any good because now they’re both miserable. But! Tony gets captured the day before he turns 18 (hes making sleeping beauty jokes about it to this day) by HYDRA, and Clint to the rescue. Because that’s his honey-eyed genius. So Clint rescues him and then Clint is offered his detail back, but he doesn’t take it. Coulson asks him why and he tells him blatantly that he has been compromised. Coulson just nods, and does his paperwork, assigning another agent to Stark’s case.

Tony thinks that’s the end of it, he won’t see the 21 year old heartbreaker again. Except he does. Because Clint shows up on Tony’s doorstep with his stupid boyish smile and asks Tony out. Tony agrees and it pisses Howard off to no end.

So they date for four years. Imagine that shit. Then they make the decision to get married. Which they really shouldn’t because Tony is cut off, and Clints gone every other month on a mission. But they get married, in Vegas. Because why the hell not. Tony wore a veil and everything. (Which Clint commented was bullshit because Tony was no blushing virgin)

It’s so not easy at all, but they make it work. Tony runs the Company while Clint does SHIELD missions. It’s not documented in SHIELD’S database because nobody really knows. Clint wears his ring on a chain, because when he uses his bow it’s too tight on his finger, but Tony wears his outright. Speculation is all over about who hes actually married to.

They have plans to renovate Clint’s family’s old Farmhouse in the country, and plan to retire there together when they’re gray and old. They sometimes do small projects at the house just to get away from it all. But it all turns to shut around AOU, When they need a place to stay, and Tony and Clint are forced into the light.

It puts a strain on things, people complaining about team dynamics and how things would change now. There’s cracks forming in their relationship, and they’re floundering to fix it. They love each other damn it, have been through so much worse. But then Clint brings in Wanda, knowing what happened with her and the team. The fights start then, worse than ever really before, and they’re on the cusp of breaking. (No Tony really is grateful for Pietro saving his husband’s life, but that doesn’t mean he had to completely trust his sister.)

They’re working on fixing themselves in the beginning of Civil War, Clint taking time off to focus on the House, Tony’s there every weekend helping. And it’s working, at least a little, because they’re together again and it’s good. But then it all turns to shit when Civil War actually hits.

Because Clint takes their side, and Tony is left wondering why. What had he done? Who had cleaned up Rogers’ mess when he and Romanov dumped the SHIELD files? He leaves, and they are suddenly fighting over a piece of paper and a man who’s been frozen for the past seventy years. When they get arrested, Tony tries to talk to Clint, tries to get him to see some side of this where they all come out okay.

But he doesn’t, and that’s where the line from the movie comes in. And Tony just shuts down. Because here was the man who had seen him at his worst, dying of blood poisoning, getting out of that god forsaken cave, and he was throwing it all away? For what? So Tony just smiles, a sad little smile and walks past the other cells, goes on his way to meet Rogers and Barnes in that god awful Bunker.

Its later, Tony visits Wakanda, limping a little and wincing whenever he bends a certain way. Clint knows something’s wrong, notices it in his eyes and how he looks at them all. There shouldn’t be such betrayal and hatred in those honey-colored eyes. Tony and Clint talk, which leads to a screaming match, which leads to the admission that, “He killed my parents Barton!” And Clint just stops. Not only at the truth, but at the name. He hadn’t called him Barton in years. It should’ve been his first clue, really it should’ve.

But Clint’s still surprised when he gets those divorce papers. Looks stunned at the name already signed on the paper. They’d both admitted to fucking up, they’d written letters back and forth when the papers were going through, in some kind of desperate attempt at salvation. But this wasn’t fixable, Clint realized. There’s no coming back from this.

[Could do small pieces of fluff where Clint tries to get back in Tony’s good Grace’s, where it ends hopefully and fluffy. But like… I think it’s just pure angst.]

But yeah, here you go. My angst-ridden Post Civil War drama, where I’m still a tad bit salty about the whole thing. But that’s okay. I arrived super late to this party, but I’m here.

Tony and Clint talk, which leads to a screaming match, which leads to the admission that, “He killed my parents Barton!” And Clint just stops. Not only at the truth, but at the name. He hadn’t called him Barton in years. It should’ve been his first clue, really it should’ve.

But Clint’s still surprised when he gets those divorce papers. Looks stunned at the name already signed on the paper. They’d both admitted to fucking up, they’d written letters back and forth when the papers were going through, in some kind of desperate attempt at salvation. But this wasn’t fixable, Clint realized. There’s no coming back from this.

[Could do small pieces of fluff where Clint tries to get back in Tony’s good Grace’s, where it ends hopefully and fluffy. But like… I think it’s just pure angst.]

But yeah, here you go. My angst-ridden Post Civil War drama, where I’m still a tad bit salty about the whole thing. But that’s okay. I arrived super late to this party, but I’m here.
trail.content:
Alright pumpkins, its headcanon/plot bunny time.

It’s time for a break from the fluffy and sweetness before we all get cavities, here’s a wonderfully angsty AU!

(More of the 85th Floor series later on, I’m not done yet.)

So I had an idea hit me, where there are a lot of “Tony/(Character) were married before Civil War.”

But I’m missing my Clint Barton/Tony Stark angst piece.

SO! I have a plot bunny. Buckle up kiddies because we’re going in. 

Tony Stark, is a valuable asset to the future of SHIELD, and as such, is protected. So when Tony goes off to MIT at the ripe age of 15, (go with it for this AU) he himself needs a handler. So, they assign young 18 year old Clint Barton to the case, who’s ready to prove himself, he’s got this.

Five kidnapping attempts, two birthdays, and a graduation later, Tony Stark is 17, and still the fluffy little nerd that Clint’s grown attached to. Queue freak out. Because he’s not supposed to get attached, hes only supposed to be there if something goes wrong. Hes certainly not supposed to know how Tony sleeps with the light on after a nightmare, or that he loves to snuggle on the couch and watch Disney movies.

So he tries distancing himself, which, doesn’t do any of them any good because now they’re both miserable. But! Tony gets captured the day before he turns 18 (hes making sleeping beauty jokes about it to this day) by HYDRA, and Clint to the rescue. Because that’s his honey-eyed genius. So Clint rescues him and then Clint is offered his detail back, but he doesn’t take it. Coulson asks him why and he tells him blatantly that he has been compromised. Coulson just nods, and does his paperwork, assigning another agent to Stark’s case.

Tony thinks that’s the end of it, he won’t see the 21 year old heartbreaker again. Except he does. Because Clint shows up on Tony’s doorstep with his stupid boyish smile and asks Tony out. Tony agrees and it pisses Howard off to no end.

So they date for four years. Imagine that shit. Then they make the decision to get married. Which they really shouldn’t because Tony is cut off, and Clints gone every other month on a mission. But they get married, in Vegas. Because why the hell not. Tony wore a veil and everything. (Which Clint commented was bullshit because Tony was no blushing virgin)

It’s so not easy at all, but they make it work. Tony runs the Company while Clint does SHIELD missions. It’s not documented in SHIELD’S database because nobody really knows. Clint wears his ring on a chain, because when he uses his bow it’s too tight on his finger, but Tony wears his outright. Speculation is all over about who hes actually married to.

They have plans to renovate Clint’s family’s old Farmhouse in the country, and plan to retire there together when they’re gray and old. They sometimes do small projects at the house just to get away from it all. But it all turns to shut around AOU, When they need a place to stay, and Tony and Clint are forced into the light.

It puts a strain on things, people complaining about team dynamics and how things would change now. There’s cracks forming in their relationship, and they’re floundering to fix it. They love each other damn it, have been through so much worse. But then Clint brings in Wanda, knowing what happened with her and the team. The fights start then, worse than ever really before, and they’re on the cusp of breaking. (No Tony really is grateful for Pietro saving his husband’s life, but that doesn’t mean he had to completely trust his sister.)

They’re working on fixing themselves in the beginning of Civil War, Clint taking time off to focus on the House, Tony’s there every weekend helping. And it’s working, at least a little, because they’re together again and it’s good. But then it all turns to shit when Civil War actually hits.

Because Clint takes their side, and Tony is left wondering why. What had he done? Who had cleaned up Rogers’ mess when he and Romanov dumped the SHIELD files? He leaves, and they are suddenly fighting over a piece of paper and a man who’s been frozen for the past seventy years. When they get arrested, Tony tries to talk to Clint, tries to get him to see some side of this where they all come out okay.

But he doesn’t, and that’s where the line from the movie comes in. And Tony just shuts down. Because here was the man who had seen him at his worst, dying of blood poisoning, getting out of that god forsaken cave, and he was throwing it all away? For what? So Tony just smiles, a sad little smile and walks past the other cells, goes on his way to meet Rogers and Barnes in that god awful Bunker.

Its later, Tony visits Wakanda, limping a little and wincing whenever he bends a certain way. Clint knows something’s wrong, notices it in his eyes and how he looks at them all. There shouldn’t be such betrayal and hatred in those honey-colored eyes. Tony and Clint talk, which leads to a screaming match, which leads to the admission that, “He killed my parents Barton!” And Clint just stops. Not only at the truth, but at the name. He hadn’t called him Barton in years. It should’ve been his first clue, really it should’ve.

But Clint’s still surprised when he gets those divorce papers. Looks stunned at the name already signed on the paper. They’d both admitted to fucking up, they’d written letters back and forth when the papers were going through, in some kind of desperate attempt at salvation. But this wasn’t fixable, Clint realized. There’s no coming back from this.

[Could do small pieces of fluff where Clint tries to get back in Tony’s good Grace’s, where it ends hopefully and fluffy. But like… I think it’s just pure angst.]

But yeah, here you go. My angst-ridden Post Civil War drama, where I’m still a tad bit salty about the whole thing. But that’s okay. I arrived super late to this party, but I’m here.

summary: also i would say that part of the reason steve is so condescensing to tony on the subject of war is that the two of them have a...
body:
also i would say that part of the reason steve is so condescensing to tony on the subject of war is that the two of them have a fundamentally different view of what war is

when steve thinks of war, he thinks of soldiers. he thinks of frontlines and gunfire and evac procedures; he thinks of bombs and planes and shelters; he thinks of supply lines and tactics.

tony grew up during the cold war, and as an adult viewed america’s destablisation of the middle east. tony has never seen the america that fights for the little guy. tony has only ever seen the america that hoards information, will kill for it, will destroy cities for it, will torture for it; he sees war that has fewer and fewer SOLDIERS every day, but more and more victims, bc that’s what howard’s technology allowed for.

and i’m not saying steve’s not cognizant of the changes, but there’s a fundamentally different PHILOSOPHY between them.

what’s more important, freedom or peace? what’s more important, privacy or accountibility?

tony’s privilege should also be taken into account. not only has tony grown up with a silver spoon in his mouth, well-educated and in a position of relative privilege as a cis white dude, but he CHOSE to become ironman, and i don’t think he really remembers how few of the other superhumans - particularly mutants - don’t have a choice, or have powers that AREN’T useful, and would be viewed by the government as inherently dangerous.

the thing about tony is that he draws a false equivalence between “having powers” and “being held accountible”, when accountibility is something that should come AFTER an act of damage, not before. but i would stress again that that POV comes from a place of trauma.

summary:
Stephen: When I’m stressed, I read a book and take my mind somewhere peaceful
Tony: When I’m stressed I spiral into a deep...
body:
Stephen: When I’m stressed, I read a book and take my mind somewhere peaceful

Tony: When I’m stressed I spiral into a deep depression, think about every mistake I’ve ever made and stay awake for days, which makes me more stressed and then I break down and cover it up with my arrogant humour.

Stephen: …

Tony: Sometimes I get donuts too
